Hi Andres,
=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0 =
Nice to see someone else out there interested in=A0these
wonderful polearms=
. Knutsen's book is one of the only ones in english that I
am aware of. Are=
 you a "practitioner" of Naginata or simply looking to study
them?
Another =
book you may want to look at is; Naginata - The Definitive Guide by
Dr. Ale=
xander Bennett.=A0 It is only available through;
HYPERLINK "http://www.kend=
o-world.com"www.kendo-world.com=A0=A0=A0=A0 A warning
though; the suppliers=
 have a "reputation" for being slow with their orders.
I placed an order 2 =
weeks ago and there hasn't been any movement on my
credit card or even an e=
-mail confirmation of my request.=A0 Expect a wait of
3-4 months! With that=
 said, the book comes with some glowing reviews since
anything on the subje=
ct in english is so rare. During the historical
developement of Japan, it's=
 amazing to see that the Katana took a backseat
to the Bow and Naginata.
=
=A0
Mark
=A0
=A0

Nihonto Pe=
ople,

I haven't seen a whole lot of books on Yari and/or Naginata in
Engli=
sh, so even though it was a bit pricy, I purchased Roald and
Susan Knutsen'=
s book ( HYPERLINK
"http://tinyurl.com/yxlhuj"http://tinyurl.-com/yxlhuj). =
I just finished it.
I am very impressed and sorry I did not purchase it ear=
lier. The
concise yet informative text plus the wealth of drawings and plat=
es
was well worth the price.

If there's anyone else out there interested i=
n the subject and that
has been on the fence about this great book because =
of the price tag,
well, stop considering it and buy it. Give it to yourself=
 for
Christmas. You won't regret it.

And if Roald and Susan subscribe to t=
hese lists (or someone who knows
them does) please receive a big thank you =
from me... This book will
be a permanent part of my reference library.

Any=
one have any other books on Yari and/or Naginata they want to
recommend? I'=
m thirsty for more knowledge now.

Thanks!

Andres
